Title: Amyra Dastur sets the temperature soaring with THIS bikini-clad photo!
Content:
FacebookTwitterPintrest

Amyra Dastur, who impressed fans with her stellar performance in Rajkummar Rao and Mouni Roy starrer 'Made in China'. The star is an avid social media user and enjoys a massive fan following. A few days back, she took the Internet by storm with her bold and beautiful bikini-clad pictures. She set the mercury levels rising as she flaunted her well-toned body.Recently, she took to her Instagram handle to share a new picture of herself and it will make you drool. Amyra looks stunning as she sported a printed bikini and posed for a perfect sun-kissed photo. The post was captioned as, ''A little sun, wind in my hair and a good dose of vitamin sea. #2020 ✨ #beachlife #goa #beachcation #thecalmbeforethestorm''. The actress often jets off to Goa to enjoy her time on the pristine beaches.Check out her post here:As soon as she shared the post, her comment section was flooded with heart and fire emoticons. She is holidaying with Richa Chadha, Harleen Sethi and others.The actress has come a long way since she made her Bollywood debut in Manish Tiwary's 'Issaq' in 2013. She also worked with Sanjay Dutt, Jackie Shroff, Manisha Koirala and others in 'Prassthanam'. She played the character of an NRI from America, who she comes to India to write her political thesis paper in 'Prassthanam'.

Title: CAA Protest Chennai: Cops probing kolam protester's Pakistan 'link'
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Kolam in front of house against CAA, NRC (File photo)

CHENNAI: The city police commissioner on Wednesday said his officers were probing the alleged Pakistan links of a woman activist booked for anti-CAA kolam protests after one of her social media accounts mentioned her as being part of an organisation based in that country.

A K Viswanathan told reporters the Facebook profile of Gayatri Kandhadai, one of those booked, says she is a researcher for Bytes For All (B4A), Pakistan, part of The Association of All Pakistan Citizen Journalists (AAPCJ) based in Pakistan. She was among eight people who held the innovative protest by drawing kolam (rangoli) before they were arrested and detained at a wedding hall on December 29. They were later released.

A few organisations like the Welfare Party of India, Arappor Iyakkam and Campus Front of India support her. "We will probe the level of her links with Pakistan," the commissioner said.

The website of Bytes for All (B4A), Pakistan says it is a human rights organisation and a research think tank with a focus on information and communication technologies. It organises discussions on relevant topics, presents findings, mobilises opinion.

On the eight people being booked, Viswanathan said no permission was issued to them to protest against CAA and NRC. "Police did not interfere until an issue was created. A protester drew the anti-CAA messages despite opposition from a houseowner," he said and showed a video of a nonagenarian saying anti-CAA messages were drawn before his house without his permission.

Later, incensed at the arrest of the protesters, DMK leaders and partymen drew similar kolams in front of their houses.

Protests, meanwhile, continued across Tamil Nadu . At midnight on Tuesday, as many as 200 activists decided to go on a procession from Panagal Maligai to Raj Bhavan when police stopped them. They raised slogans for nearly an hour and dispersed. In Nagapattinam, more than 2,000 people took out a rally on Wednesday demanding that the Centre revoke CAA. The procession, led by Nagappattinam MLA Thamimun Ansari and Kilvelur DMK MLA U Mathivanan, got participation from others parties. In Trichy, police booked members of Makkal Adhikaram, who were also holding an anti-CAA protest, for unlawful assembly.

Title: Cricketers to pay tribute to Australia firefighters, brace for smoke delays
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Sydney, Jan 2 (AFP) Australia and New Zealand cricketers will pay tribute to firefighters and bushfire victims during the third Test in Sydney, officials said Thursday, as they prepare for possible delays if air quality plummets due to smoke. At least 18 people have lost their lives in one of Australia's most devastating bushfire seasons which has seen blazes raging across the country, including on the outskirts of Sydney. The match, starting Friday, will go ahead but play will be suspended at the umpire's discretion, should smoke significantly affect air quality or visibility. Saturday is shaping as of most concern, when another heatwave is expected to sweep across the country and create dangerous fire conditions. "Like rain, the rules are in place to add time, to suspend play (for Tests). But what we're finding is it (smoke) comes in quick but also goes quick," Cricket Australia's head of operations Peter Roach told cricket.com.au. "It's unlikely, we believe, it'll be there for a full day. "We might see some challenges across that day, but we'll play it like rain or adverse weather. Time can be added on." Before play on Friday both sides will take part in a minute's applause for fire and emergency services workers and wear black armbands as a mark of respect for those who have died. Cricket Australia also announced a fundraising drive for the Australian Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery Fund during one-day matches between Australia and New Zealand in Sydney in March. "On behalf of Australian cricket, we wish everyone fighting the fires across Australia a safe New Year," Australia coach Justin Langer and captain Tim Paine said in a joint letter published in local media Thursday. "We pray the conditions improve, the fires ease and the rains come. And, above all else, we hope all Australians pull together and help each other through this incredibly difficult time." The issue of smoke is a difficult one for cricket officials, who currently rely on a mix of air quality guidelines from the International Cricket Council, state governments and the Australian Institute of Sport. But there are inconsistencies on what is considered "unsafe". A Big Bash League match in Canberra was abandoned this month because of toxic bushfire haze, but several have been played in Sydney since the season began two weeks ago. At last month's Australian Open golf in Sydney, players complained of stinging eyes and trouble breathing, and New Zealand's Ryan Chisnall wore a face mask. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Why you may not get bird’s-eye view of Delhi from height of 154m
Content:
Signature Bridge

NEW DELHI: There’s disappointment in store for those who looked forward to a 360-degree view of Delhi from the observatory deck atop Signature Bridge. Delhi government sources disclosed that the two inclined and two vertical elevators facilitating access to the four-storey viewers’ gallery were not capable of handing the expected rush of visitors.The viewers’ gallery is located at a height of 154 metres, twice that of the Qutab Minar. The gallery has a façade of thick glass which can be expected to get very hot at peak summer and this was another challenge for the government in its plan to haul people up for a bird’s-eye view of the capital.Though Delhi Tourism and Transportation Development Corporation (DTTDC), the agency executing the project, is working on some “modifications” in the design including widening of staircases to make them more spacious, officials privy to the status of the project said the final decision on whether the deck will be opened to the public lies with the political leadership.Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia, who is also in charge of tourism department, did not respond to repeated attempts to contact him on the issue.Constructed at a cost of Rs1,518 crore, Signature Bridge was conceived of in 2004 and approved by the Sheila Dikshit government in 2007. It took more than 11 years for its inauguration in 2018, with the viewing deck and the glass façade taking another year for completion.The triangular-shaped inclined lifts go up 70 metres. These are connected with the second set of vertical lifts with three flight of stairs. The vertical lifts then travel up 60 metres to reach the four-level observatory deck, which has spiral staircases. This design makes the elevators very slow and it takes around four minutes for visitors to reach the observatory deck.“Due to the peculiar design, space constraint and slow speed of the elevators, some people may feel claustrophobic inside. The system may not get safety certificates from the fire and labour departments,” said an official. Trial runs of the four elevators are currently in progress.The elevators currently have simple fans though provisions for air-conditioning are being made, said sources. The elevators can accommodate four passengers at a time while the viewers’ gallery has a capacity for 50 people.The government contemplated building another tower with a bullet lift parallel to the existing structure and connect it with the observatory deck. “We had a discussion with the German consultant who oversaw the original structure, but he shot down the proposal,” revealed an official.DTTDC, however, is continuing the work to illuminate the bridge, pylons and steel cables. A separate agency has been hired to install theme lighting, the pattern of which will change as appropriate to national festivals. The lighting is likely to be inaugurated in the next few days.The construction agency is also connecting the sidewalk of the bridge with the parking area through a 300-metre walkway on the western side. The parking bay, which can accommodate 100 vehicles, also has an open-air plaza, eateries, play zone for children and public conveniences.

Title: Arsenal blow away Man Utd to hand Arteta first win
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

London, Jan 2 (AFP) Mikel Arteta got everything he asked for in his first win as Arsenal manager with a rampant first 45 minutes from the Gunners earning a 2-0 victory over Manchester United at the Emirates. Nicolas Pepe and Sokratis Papastathopoulos scored the goals to secure just a second win in 16 games. Arsenal started the game three times as many points off the top four as the relegation zone, but a first home win in 87 days hauls Arteta's men up to 10th and within four points of United in fifth. "I am very pleased with the performance, I'm even more pleased with the result," said Arteta after his third game in charge. "Everything I wanted to see on the pitch, I saw tonight." There were signs of encouragement for Arsenal in Arteta's home debut against Chelsea on Sunday when only a late collapse saw a 1-0 lead turn into a 2-1 defeat. However, this time the hosts saw the game through as a dismal United performance raised fresh questions over their chances of finishing in the top four. "At the moment we are suffering to maintain that level of intensity of the first halves," added Arteta. "That will come, but as well I really liked the resilience they showed. I liked to see them suffer together." Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's men were again shorn of Paul Pogba, who faces another month out after an operation on a troublesome ankle injury that has kept him out for the majority of the season. Pogba's absence is still evident in United's inability to create when denied the chance to counter-attack and they failed to recover after falling behind early on. "After they scored the first goal, it seemed like they got loads of energy," said Solskjaer. "They were the better team. They were aggressive, they regained the ball and it was hard to get the ball off them." For the first time Arsenal started with all of Pepe, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, Alexandre Lacazette and Mesut Ozil together in attack and Arteta's bold choice paid dividends eight minutes in. Pepe scored just his second Premier League goal from open play since a �72 million move from Lille when he swept home Sead Kolasinac's cross at the back post. The Ivorian was suddenly brimming with confidence as he twisted and turned Luke Shaw before crossing for Aubameyang to volley just over. Lacazette then rolled Harry Maguire easily in a night to forget for the world's most expensive defender before pulling his shot across goal. David de Gea is another of United's more experienced stars suffering an alarming dip in form and a poor clearance from the Spaniard offered another sight of goal to Pepe, whose long-range strike came back off the post. Arsenal's first half dominance was rewarded with a second goal before the half-time interval as De Gea could only palm Lacazette's header from a corner back into the danger area and Sokratis pounced to fire into the roof of the net. As the hosts' energy levels dipped from a frantic first 45 minutes, United were allowed to dictate the game but did not have the guile to make their possession count. Andreas Pereira had the best chance to give United a lifeline but fired into the side-netting from Nemanja Matic's clever reverse pass. "We have to be honest and admit physically we are not ready, but you have to show heart and this team is ready to change a lot of things," said Arsenal defender David Luiz. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Delhi: Conductor killed as interstate bus overturns
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: The conductor of a Rajasthan Roadways bus was killed after the vehicle overturned while coming down the flyover in front of Hyatt hotel in south Delhi on Wednesday morning. The fire department received a call around 7am. Police said that the driver of the vehicle and some passengers had fled the spot.

The deceased was identified as Vijay Singh Barala (25) who hails from Rajasthan. “Three fire tenders were rushed as soon as we got a call. The firemen pulled out the conductor, who succumbed to his injuries at the hospital,” said Atul Garg, director, Delhi Fire Service.

A police officer said that the bus was coming from Jaipur to New Delhi. “The final destination was Sarai Kale Khan. A case of rash and negligent driving and death due to negligence has been registered,” he said. “Efforts are on to nab the bus driver.”

Prima facie, it appears that the bus was overspeeding and hit the divider, after which it overturned. Delhi Police had to call a crane to remove the vehicle that was affecting traffic movement in the area.

Title: Tipeshwar tiger ventures near Ajanta Caves, returns in 8 days
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: A young male collared tiger from Tipeshwar wildlife sanctuary lived in the area around the worldfamous Ajanta Caves and stayed for about eight days before heading towards Dnyanganga sanctuary in Buldhana district .

The collared tiger C1, moved within a two-km radius of the world heritage site in Fardapur and Soyegaon areas around Ajanta caves. An alert about its presence was sent to the forest department in Aurangabad by the Wildlife Institute of India (WII). WII, in collaboration with forest department, has taken up long-term monitoring studies of tigers and in March 2019 had installed radio collars on a couple of them.

Citing information received from WII, forest department officials said the tiger entered the area sometime after December 15 and stayed till December 25, before starting its journey towards Dnyanganga sanctuary on December 26. Deputy forest conservator Satish Wadkar confirmed that the tiger was within a two-km radius of Ajanta caves and Fardapur between mid-December and December 25.

Authorities say they kept the news of C1’s movements under wraps to ensure that no panic-like situation arose since the world heritage monument is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists every day. They also wanted to ensure the wild cat’s safety and security.

Forest officials were relieved to see the three-year-old tiger leave the area without accident. “The tiger preyed only on wild animals in the jungle patches and did not head towards human settlements and farms during his stay here. Any man-animal conflict around the world heritage site would have attracted negative publicity for the wild cat, which we seriously do not want,” said a forest official.

“To ensure that it is not bothered or disturbed, we had decided to keep the development under wraps,” said a senior forest official, who was part of the team that camped in Ajanta at night. As a precautionary measure, teams of the forest department, armed with guns loaded with tranquillizers, were deployed in and around Ajanta and Fardapur jungle to respond to any reports of man-animal conflict.

Forest officials said the tiger originally belongs to Tipeshwar wildlife sanctuary and since leaving it on June 23, 2019, has travelled well over 1,700 km.

Title: Mourinho concerned over Kane injury, annoyed at Ndombele
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Southampton, Jan 2 (AP) Tottenham is waiting to find out the extent of Harry Kane's hamstring injury after the striker left Southampton's stadium on crutches after a 1-0 loss at Southampton on Wednesday. Kane picked up the problem in the process of scoring an offside goal, sparking fears he could be set for a lengthy spell on the sidelines. "For Harry to come out is negative," Tottenham manager Jose Mourinho said. "Hamstring is always a negative. Is it tear? Is it a spasm? Is it a contraction? In this moment I cannot say." Kane was not the only player Spurs lost to injury as Tanguy Ndombele limped off in the first half and it caused Mourinho to lose his patience. The France midfielder has been beset by fitness concerns following his summer move from Lyon and recently told his manager that he did not want to be selected for the Boxing Day win over Brighton. Mourinho did not hold back in his assessment of the club's record signing, who was brought in by previous manager Mauricio Pochettino. "He is always injured, he is injured, is not injured," Mourinho said. "He plays one match, the next week he is injured, he plays another match. We are full of hopes and this is since the beginning of the season. "Of course it is a concern, you think you have a player, you think the player is in an evolution process, he plays very well against Norwich, you think today he is ready for it and he is not ready for it. I cannot say much more than that because it is a situation that comes from the beginning of the season." (AP) APA APA

Title: Arteta earns first win as Arsenal sink Man Utd, but Spurs, Chelsea stumble
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

London, Jan 2 (AFP) Arsenal rang in the new year by giving boss Mikel Arteta his first victory as lacklustre Manchester United crashed to a 2-0 defeat, while Tottenham and Chelsea also slipped up in the Premier League's top four race on Wednesday. Arteta had watched Arsenal take only one point from his first two matches, with last weekend's 2-1 defeat against Chelsea especially painful after the Blues scored twice in the final minutes. But Arsenal had played well for long periods in that London derby and they produced an even more sparkling display to put United to the sword at the Emirates Stadium. The Gunners took the lead in the eighth minute when Sead Kolasinac's cross ran through to Nicolas Pepe at the far post and the Ivory Coast winger beat David De Gea from close-range. Arsenal, who last won in the league at West Ham on December 9, got a deserved second goal in the 43rd minute when De Gea kept out Alexandre Lacazette's flick and Sokratis reacted quickest to lash home. Arteta's team are nine points adrift of the top four, but their second win in 16 matches in all competitions offers hope of a brighter future under the former Arsenal midfielder's management. "It feels great, incredible. I'm so happy and proud of the players," Arteta said. "Physically the level dropped in the second half but the commitment and desire was terrific. "The performances are getting better so I was desperate for the win and we got it." United are fifth, five points behind fourth placed Chelsea, after the latest in a long list of underwhelming performances in a troubled campaign. "We started decent the first five or six minutes, didn't capitalise, and then they played really well," United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said. "We were too slow in the first half, but that's credit to them. Some tired heads maybe." Chelsea remain in pole position to secure the fourth Champions League qualification place but manager Frank Lampard will rue conceding a spectacular late equaliser in the 1-1 draw at Brighton. Cesar Azpilicueta gave Chelsea the lead, tapping in from close-range in the 10th minute. But Brighton scored the goal their persistence deserved in the 84th minute when Iranian substitute Alireza Jahanbakhsh acrobatically found the bottom-left corner with an overhead kick. "It was frustrating for different reasons," Lampard said. "We weren't ruthless enough. We got the goal and we had the possession. But we just didn't kill the game off." Those dropped points gave Jose Mourinho's Spurs the chance to crank up the pressure on Chelsea and United, but they slipped to a 1-0 defeat at Southampton and England captain Harry Kane limped off with a hamstring injury. - Spurs unravel - ================= Tottenham fell behind to a 17th-minute Danny Ings goal and Kane injured himself as he converted Christian Eriksen's free-kick in the second half but was flagged offside. Mourinho's frustration boiled over as he was shown a yellow card after an altercation with the Southampton bench. "I was rude," Mourinho said. "I clearly deserved the yellow card. I had bad words." Elsewhere at the top of the table, second-placed Leicester cruised to a 3-0 win at Newcastle and Manchester City beat Everton 2-1 to hand Carlo Ancelotti his first defeat since taking over as manager. Leicester appear to have put a mini-slump behind them, courtesy of goals from Ayoze Perez, James Maddison and Hamza Choudhury to move to within 10 points of leaders Liverpool. City remain in third after their home win against Everton, a single point behind Leicester. Gabriel Jesus scored twice in the second half at the Etihad before Richarlison pulled a goal back for Everton but City held on despite some nervy moments. "This period is so tough. When you are far away from the first position sometimes people give up, but we never give up," City boss Pep Guardiola said. Struggling West Ham made a flying start under Moyes, returning to the London Stadium for a second stint as manager, hammering hapless Bournemouth 4-0 and lifting themselves out of the relegation zone, with the visitors now in the bottom three. Watford continued their impressive run under new manager Nigel Pearson, holding on to beat seventh-placed Wolves 2-1. Villa beat Burnley 2-1 with first-half goals from Wesley and Jack Grealish while Norwich drew 1-1 with Crystal Palace. (AFP) APA APA

Title: Thomas set to tee it up at first PGA Tour event of 2020
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Los Angeles, Jan 2 (AFP) Justin Thomas' all-around game has made him one of the hottest players on the PGA Tour and the American will try to carry that momentum into this week's Tournament of Champions, the first event of 2020. Thomas, Dustin Johnson and Jon Rahm are the headliners for the event as the tour returns from a December hiatus at the par-73 Plantation Course in Kapalua, Hawaii. The field, which consists of only those who won on the tour last year, includes just 34 golfers after several notable winners decided to skip the no-cut event. Top-ranked Brooks Koepka is out with a left knee injury while Rory McIlroy, Phil Mickelson and Tiger Woods also qualified but opted not to play, as did Justin Rose, Francesco Molinari and British Open champion Shane Lowry. That sets the stage for Thomas to take advantage. Thomas said his goal for 2020 is to get back to the world number one ranking. "All the motivation I need to get to number one in the world is in myself," he said. "I don't need to try to prove anybody wrong. "I don't need to do it because people said I can't. Because I want to be there is big enough motivation for me." The 26-year-old Thomas, one of only 10 players in PGA history to shoot a sub-60 round, won the BMW Championship in August, finished fourth at the Safeway Open in September and won the CJ Cup in October. Thomas also did well at the Presidents Cup in Australia last month, finishing with a record of 3-1-1, his loss coming in the singles competition. The 2017 PGA Championship winner, Thomas has a burning desire to put together a complete season and get off to a strong start after last year was interrupted by a nagging right wrist injury. "Yeah, I could have been a pity party and asked for more attention, but I definitely didn't deserve anything special," said Thomas, who has qualified for this event four of the past five years. "I mean, I hadn't done what I had the year before and definitely not two years before that. "Even with the injury happening, I tried to stay patient, and I was glad to see it kind of come back to how it felt at the end of the year." Thomas will have competition from world number three Rahm, who is the top-ranked player in the field. Spain's Rahm has three wins and 10 top-10s in his past 13 starts worldwide, vaulting him to a career-high ranking. Johnson is making his first start of the 2019-20 season and has seven consecutive top-10 finishes in the event. Defending champion Xander Schauffele overcame a five-shot deficit entering the final round last year by posting a tournament-record 62 on Sunday. He is trying to become the first player since Geoff Ogilvy (2009-10) to repeat as champion. (AFP) APA APA

Title: RBI launches app to help the blind identify notes
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: Reserve Bank of India on Wednesday launched a mobile application, MANI (Mobile Aided Note Identifier), to aid visually impaired persons in identifying the denomination of currency notes.The app, which can be freely downloaded from Android Play Store and iOS App Store , was launched by RBI governor Shaktikanta Das. Once installed, the app can be used to scan all currency notes of Mahatma Gandhi series (new and old).Once the note is scanned, the app will cause the phone to buzz and the user will get an audio notification in Hindi as well as English. The app can be used in offline mode without internet connectivity."Indian banknotes contain several features which enable the visually impaired to identify them, viz., intaglio printing and tactile mark, variable banknote size, large numerals, variable colour, monochromatic hues and patterns," RBI said in a statement. "Technological progress has opened up new opportunities for making Indian banknotes more accessible for the visually impaired, thereby facilitating their day to day transactions," it added.The app is designed to help those with only visual or visual and hearing disability using the vibration mode. For those who are hearing impaired as well, the user can detect the note by checking the number of vibrations which increase with the denomination. For instance, for a ten-rupee note the phone will buzz twice. This will increase progressively up to eight times for a 2,000 note.RBI has been taking several initiatives to improve accessibility to those with disabilities. Earlier RBI had asked banks to to offer banking facilities including cheque book facility/operation of ATM/locker to the visually challenged as they are legally competent to contract.This followed a 2005 order by the Court of Chief Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities which said that the visually impaired persons cannot be denied a cheque book facility.Indian Banks' Association, in turn, had framed operational guidelines for implementation of its member banks on providing banking facilities. One of this was to provide talking ATMs with Braille keypads to facilitate use by persons with visual impairmentRBI had directed banks to ensure at least one-third of new ATMs installed as talking ATMs with Braille keypads and place them strategically in consultation with other banks to ensure that at least one talking ATM with Braille keypad is generally available in each locality.

Title: Pogba set for operation in new injury setback
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

London, Jan 2 (AFP) Paul Pogba will undergo surgery on a recurring ankle injury and is expected to spend another month on the sidelines, Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer confirmed after his side's 2-0 defeat to Arsenal on Wednesday. The French World Cup winner made his comeback after nearly three months out in a 2-0 defeat at Watford 10 days ago and also made an appearance off the bench in a 4-1 thrashing of Newcastle four days later. "We've had scans and it's nothing major, it's something that has to be sorted and dealt with. He's been advised to it as soon as," said Solskjaer. Pogba has made just six starts in all competitions for United this season and his influence in midfield has been badly missed with United sitting fifth in the Premier League. His latest setback comes at a bad time for Solskjaer with Scott McTominay also sidelined for two months leaving the Norwegian extremely short on midfield options. "It's a big blow that Paul is out now that Scott's out, he'll be out for a few months. Paul will be back within a month." Speculation also surrounds Pogba's future at Old Trafford after he expressed a desire to leave the club before the start of the season. Real Madrid reportedly remain interested in the man who cost United a then world record �89 million ($117 million) in 2016, but no move is expected to be made in the January transfer window. And Solskjaer denied suggestions it is Pogba's own medical team rather than the club's which has suggested to undergo surgery at this time. "We look after our players' health," added Solskjaer. "It's been advised that he should do it as soon as possible." (AFP) APA APA

Title: Bengaluru: Netizens thank cops for New Year's Eve vigilance
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: Police, who usually draw flak from the public, earned appreciation from Bengalureans on Wednesday for ensuring the city ushered in 2020 peacefully.

Thousands of revellers had converged at the Brigade Road-MG Road intersection on Tuesday midnight and the massive deployment of 15,000 police personnel along with the CCTV surveillance ensured there was no room for mischief-mongers.

Bikash tagged Bengaluru’s police’s handle and tweeted: “Yesterday had been there with my family members, the amount of security provided from you guys was very superior. Those island with safety precautions and women safety centre all over the place, seemed to boost confidence of safety for every Bengalureans ; kudos to great effort” (sic).

Meanwhile, city police commissioner Bhaskar Rao congratulated women who boldly reacted to hooligans at MG Road in videos that have since gone viral on social media platforms.

Title: Gurugram: One dies as SUV rams divider in Manesar, overturns
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

GURUGRAM: A 50-year-old man from Jaipur died and three others were injured in the early hours of Wednesday after the SUV they were travelling in rammed a divider and overturned on NH-8 in Manesar. The crash occurred after a speeding heavy goods vehicle brushed past the SUV while overtaking it, causing the latter to lose balance. The driver of the lorry has been booked.

Mohammad Salim was headed to Delhi to trace his 21-year-old daughter, who had allegedly eloped with a youth last month. Police said they tracked her mobile phone to Delhi. Salim, along with several family members and police officers, left Jaipur in three vehicles late on Tuesday night, planning to reach Delhi early in the morning.

Salim, his wife, father and the family’s driver were travelling in a white Mahindra Quanto. Police were travelling in a van ahead of them, while another car with more family members was following the SUV at some distance.

Around 4am on Wednesday, the SUV had reached Manesar. A lorry behind the SUV, which, police said, was being driven at a high speed, sped up in an effort to overtake the latter, brushing past it. The driver of the SUV lost control due to the impact, hit the divider near Manesar bus stand and crashed into the opposite carriageway. The car flipped several times in the air before landing. “In the process, the rear door of the SUV broke open and Salim, who was sitting on that side, was thrown out and crushed by the vehicle. He died on the spot,” police said.

The other three persons inside the SUV were injured. Passersby informed police, who took them to hospital.

Title: Prakash Javadekar: AAP, Congress hit back after Prakash Javadekar accuses them of inciting violence
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Prakash Javadekar

NEW DELHI: Ahead of the upcoming assembly polls in Delhi, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday once again blamed Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and Congress for violence during the protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act.

Union minister and BJP’s Delhi election incharge Prakash Javadekar alleged that the leaders of the two parties incited the violence instead of condemning it.

“AAP and Congress are responsible for the violence during protests against CAA in Delhi. The parties have maintained silence and did not condemn violence and their people incited it,” Javadekar alleged. He added that the upcoming polls in Delhi were going to be a contest of “nationalism versus anarchy” and “truth versus falsehood”.

Javadekar also named the functionaries of the two parties from Muslim-dominated assembly constituencies of “misleading” the minority community.

Both the AAP and Congress rubbished Javadekar’s charges and hit back at BJP.

Senior AAP leader and deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia said that the party known for spreading violence was accusing other political parties of it. “We have said it umpteen number of times that the AAP condemns any form of violence,” he said. “Leaders of BJP have been reiterating the same statement like a tape recorder because they have no real issue to contest the assembly elections in the capital.”

Delhi Congress chief Subhash Chopra said that BJP was “rattled” by the “solid position” of his party ahead of the polls and hence was levelling baseless allegations. “Congress never endorses violence in any form, while everyone knows the history of BJP. Congress opposes the CAA but only supports peaceful and democratic protests against it,” Chopra said.

Exuding confidence that BJP will win the upcoming polls, Javadekar said that the saffron party will contest the elections with “positive” mindset and achieve “complete development” of Delhi.

“Modi government has initiated several schemes for the people of Delhi, which we will present to the electorate in the upcoming elections.

We will also share our vision for the next five years and expose the failures of AAP government,” the Union minister said.

On the issue of party’s CM face for the upcoming polls, Javadekar said nothing had been decided. “BJP takes right decision at the right time as per strategy. As soon as we take any decision about this, we will inform you,” he said. He added that the party will start selecting candidates for the 70 assembly seats “soon”.

Title: Centre releases Rs 267 crore for infra in Maoist areas in Andhra
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

VISAKHAPATNAM: The central government has released Rs 267 crore to build infrastructure in Maoists strongholds.

The work will be taken up under the Road Connectivity Project for Left Wing Extremism Affected Area (RCPLWE) and the funds were released through the Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana .

The funds will be used to lay 44 roads, around 400 km, and two bridges. The project is set to be taken up in phases and completed by the end of this year. While tenders have been finalised for a few roads, the remaining would be finalised in a month or two.

The central government has chalked out plans to provide road connectivity in Maoist affected areas in seven states to curb Maoist menace.

As part of it, in Andhra Pradesh the project will be taken up mainly in East Godavari and Visakhapatnam .

According to sources, more than 1,500 villages or hamlets, which are Maoist strongholds, lack road, in the Visakha Agency lack proper roads.

Presently, the second phase of work has been taken up that includes 35 roads, around 165 km, with an estimated cost of around ?120 crore.

The third phase will include laying of 410 km of roads and the remaining roads will be laid after the remaining funds are released by the end of August, sources said.

Title: Rishad Premji: Wipro's Rishad Premji may lose executive chairman role due to new Sebi rules
Content:
Rishad Premji (File photo)

BENGALURU/MUMBAI: Wipro’s Rishad Premji may cease to continue as the company’s chairman in an executive role if Sebi’s guidelines on segregation of the positions of chairman and CEO/managing director in the top 500-listed companies comes into effect on April 1.Wipro had submitted a proposal to markets regulator Sebi, seeking its permission to allow Rishad to continue in an executive role following a transition that was on expected lines and was set in motion after his father and former chairman Azim Premji stepped down from his executive role last year.After the transition, the senior Premji was designated founder-chairman and was reappointed to Wipro’s board as non-executive director for a period of five years. TOI had reported previously that once Sebi’s new rules are implemented, it will be one of the rare instances where the promoter family — despite enjoying a 74% shareholding in the company — will play no role in the day-to-day affairs running of the IT blue chip.Sources said that Sebi had communicated to Wipro that since Rishad, despite being the chairman of the board will also play an executive role in the company, the structure will not meet the regulator’s rule to segregate the roles of chairman and CEO ‘in letter and spirit’.The new rule mandates that the chairperson of the board must be a non-executive director. It was first proposed in 2017 by Sebi’s committee on corporate governance, headed by leading banker Uday Kotak. The basis of the new rule is to segregate the board of a listed company from its management. In 2018, Sebi made it a rule and gave top 500 listed companies (by market capitalisation) two years to move to the new structure, which will be effective April 1.When TOI reached out to Wipro, its spokesperson clarified that in July, founder-chairman Azim was reappointed to the board of Wipro as a non-executive director for a period of five years, but reiterated, “Wipro will abide by all applicable regulatory norms.”In its annual report for fiscal 2019, Wipro said that as and when the amended regulation relating to appointment of non-executive chairman by listed entities come into effect, “Rishad A Premji will cease to perform any executive role in the company and continue in the capacity of non-executive director of the company, such that the company remains compliant with the listing regulations in force at all times”.Although Azim has committed 67% of Wipro’s stake to his philanthropic foundation, the family continues to have the voting rights on these shares.However, Shriram Subramanian, founder & MD of proxy advisory services InGovern Research Services, spoke of another possible scenario. Since there’s growing clamour among some corporates not to separate the roles of chairman and MD, “in this background, two emerging possibilities are Rishad becoming the company’s non-executive chairman or taking the role of a joint MD after giving up his executive chairman role,” he said.The junior Premji has done multiple gigs at Wipro. From a quiet backroom operator, he rose through the ranks to become its chairman. Over the years, he headed investor relations and corporate affairs, and then as its chief strategy officer was instrumental in aligning Wipro’s strategy with the future needs of the business. Early on in his tenure, Rishad was credited with spearheading the integration of Citi Technology Services following Wipro’s acquisition of Citibank’s captive technology arm. Citi is one of Wipro’s top customers in the BFSI space. He is also credited with setting up Wipro Ventures, the company’s $100-million corporate VC arm that backs startups developing solutions that could complement Wipro’s businesses in future.

Title: Rs 15 crore worth hauls in a year from sand dredgers in Palghar
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Illegal seizure of sand and drugs hauls fetched crores of rupees for the Palghar district police in the year 2019.

Between January 1 and December 29 last year, 112 cases of illegal sand dredging were filed across various police stations in the district. A total of 263 men were booked and sand and vehicles worth Rs14.6 crore were seized.

Drugs worth Rs19.68 crore were seized from the district, and 118 persons were booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act. A huge consignment of the banned gutka was seized from vehicles entering the district. Police said that the seized products were worth Rs12.88 crore, and 182 cases were registered. The illegal transportation of liquor fetched Rs2.49 crore for police.

Several arrests were made under the Arms Act, and weapons worth Rs62 lakh was seized in the district. Police said that 29 accused were held with weapons. Raids on gambling dens in the district led to the arrest of 436 persons and Rs58.25 lakh was the amount seized.

In addition to the seizures, police lodged 12 cases against illegal Bangladeshi nationals and booked 57 persons. A total of 18 cases were made under The Immoral Trafficking (Prevention) Act (PETA) and 36 persons were booked. Sand dredging has been rampant in Palghar, with trucks transporting illegally drawn sand. In many cases dredgers and transporters flee when a raid takes place.

Title: Mumbai: To escape traffic smokehouse, foreign schools branch out
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

The American School of Bombay’s main campus at BKC.

MUMBAI: One city, awful traffic equals multiple campuses. Mumbai’s road congestion has impelled one of the city’s most elite schools to set up branches across the metropolis. The idea is not to up its student intake, but to allow the existing community to simply walk to school.

This academic year, the American School of Bombay (ASB) travelled closer for residents of north Mumbai. With their headquarters in BKC and a campus for juniors in Kurla , the consulate school started a facility in Powai . This is the second foreign school in the Knowledge Park with the Japanese School also moving from Worli to Powai. Soon, more centres will come up in other parts of Mumbai.

To beat the city’s traffic and promote diversity in the class, ASB, which runs a three-hour school for its lowest sections, decided to open the satellite campus, replete with a library, a learn-to-swim indoor pool, a sensory spa, and a live kitchen-canteen. The Powai centre currently has about 20 children, but given the area’s large expat community, the number is likely to grow.

ASB, which largely caters to expats and a floating foreign population, was recently permitted by the external affairs ministry to open its doors to locals too. About 6% of its student population is now Indian.

“We see ourselves as being a five-campus school in the next two years,” said principal Craig Johnson. After the Powai campus came up, residents of Juhu and south Mumbai have pressed for setups in their respective neighbourhoods. Even the initiation of the Powai school lay in parents speaking to the authorities about the time taken to travel from home to school and back. “It started with parents discussing the matter with us last year. We realized that travel time was too much for our students attending the early childhood classes,” said ASB’s COO, Alok Parashar.

Currently, the ASB Powai Learning Village, as it is called, is an early childhood campus catering to pre-K3, pre-K4 and kindergarten students. “However, if we get a request from parents to add a year or two, we will do so too,” said Parashar.

Title: Pakistan Army Act: Pak govt OKs changes in Army Act, likely tied to tenure of services chiefs
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Pakistan army chief General Bajwa

ISLAMABAD: The Pakistan government in an emergency meeting on Wednesday approved amendments to the Army Act, nearly four weeks after it assured the Supreme Court of passing a legislation on the extension and reappointment of an Army chief within six months. Prime Minister Imran Khan had extended army chief Gen Qamar Javed Bajwa 's tenure through a notification on August 19. However, on November 26, the Supreme Court suspended the government order, citing irregularities in the manner the army chief, a close confidant of the prime minister, was granted an extension. On November 28, Bajwa got a six-month conditional extension from the apex court, ending an unprecedented legal wrangle that shook the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) government and pitted the powerful military against the judiciary. Chief Justice Asif Saeed Khosa, who headed a three-member bench, announced the verdict after getting an assurance from the government that Parliament will pass a legislation on the extension/reappointment of an army chief within six months. In Wednesday's meeting, which was presided over by Prime Minister Khan, the amendments made to the clauses related to the Army chief's tenure and extension were passed unanimously, the Dawn News reported. The amended Bill will now be presented before the Parliament in order to come into effect. Though the details regarding the amendments are not yet clear, defence minister Pervez Khattak said it include a proposal to extend the tenure of all the three services chief.

Title: Cars below Delhi Metro: Work to begin on first double elevated stretch
Content:
A Delhi Metro train (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Delhi Metro ’s plan to build an elevated corridor on Mehrauli-Badarpur Road on a single pillar that will have two separate corridors for vehicles and metro is one step closer to reality.Two days after it started construction work on Janakpuri West-RK Ashram Marg corridor under Phase IV, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation awarded the first civil contract for Tughlaqabad-Aerocity corridor, which is 20.2kmlong with 15 stations.While the corridor will connect Violet Line (Kashmere Gate-Raja Nahar Singh) with Airport Express Line, the highlight of this section is a double-decker viaduct that will include the metro viaduct as well as an elevated six-lane flyover from Sangam Vihar to Ambedkar Nagar. The metro viaduct will be on the upper deck at an elevation of 18 metres, while the road flyover will be on the lower deck at 9.3 metres. The total length of the integrated structure will be 2.4km, providing a first-of-akind three-layered transport facility on this section. A 430mlong, six-lane underpass will also be constructed at Saket-G block at Mandir Marg crossing.“Three corridors of Phase IV have so far been approved under which 61.6km of new metro lines will be constructed across three different corridors comprising 45 stations,” Anuj Dayal, executive director, corporate communication, DMRC, said.The first civil contract for the corridor awarded on Wednesday involves construction of a metro viaduct from Sangam Vihar to Saket-G block, including four elevated stations — Sangam Vihar, Khanpur-Devoli, Ambedkar Nagar and Saket-G block.“After construction of this stretch, the Mehrauli-Badarpur Road will be signal-free from Sangam Vihar to Saket. The work will be completed in about three years,” Dayal said.The other two civil contracts awarded for Phase IV corridors include one for construction of 10 stations on Janakpuri West-RK Ashram Marg corridor — Keshopur, Paschim Vihar, Peeragarhi, Mangolpuri, West Enclave, Pushpanjali, Deepali Chowk, Madhuban Chowk, Prashant Vihar and North Pitampura — and another for Maujpur-Majlis Park corridor. The latter comprises a bridge across Yamuna and an integrated elevated viaduct with a PWD flyover at the lower deck and a metro line at the upper deck from Yamuna Vihar to Bhajanpura and eight elevated stations — Yamuna Vihar, Bhajanpura, Khajuri Khas, Sonia Vihar, Soorghat, Jagatpur Village, Jharoda and Burari.Construction work under Phase IV commenced on December 30 last year at Haiderpur Badli Mor on Janakpuri West-RK Ashram Marg corridor, where piling work was started in the presence of DMRC’s managing director Mangu Singh.In Video: Delhi Metro: Work to begin on a first double elevated stretch

Title: Malvika Bansod gets support to develop her badminton career
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

File image of Malvika Bansod (TOI Photo)

NAGPUR: The year 2019 was almost a perfect one for Malvika Bansod . Fittingly enough, she ended the year with her career-best world ranking of 169 when the Badminton World Federation (BWF) updated the rankings on Tuesday, the last day of 2019.

The 18-year-old took a massive jump of 283 spots to reach 169 from a lowly 452 in the women’s singles world rankings. All this happened in just over three months when she made an international debut in the senior category with her participation in the Maldives International Future Series tournament in September. In addition to that, she has also bagged a lucrative five-year contract with Vishvaraj Infrastructure Ltd (VIL).

The in-form teenager’s spectacular performance was noticed by GoSports Foundation , which has promised to help her in boosting her career.

Malvika is delighted with the latest development and believes it will certainly boost her career in a big way.

“I am grateful to the GoSports Foundation for extending the support. It’s an elite organisation and I am glad that I was chosen by them. I have been selected in a long-term athlete development programme on the basis of my performance in national and international tournaments,” Malvika told TOI on Wednesday.

Currently training at Raipur under the watchful eyes of chief national junior coach Sanjay Mishra, Malvika is aiming for a spot in the senior Indian side sooner than later.

The forthcoming two All India Senior Ranking tournaments at Bengaluru (January 7 to 13) and Goa (January 15 to 20) are the selection trials for the Indian team that will compete in the Asian Badminton Championships next month.

“I want to thank my coach Sanjay Mishra for helping me improve my game in the last few months. I am also thankful to MBA president Arun Lakhani and VIL, without whose support I wouldn’t have played and performed well,” said Malvika, a student of Shivaji Science College.

challenge of provisional answer key January 1 to 3, 2020

The last date to pay the required fee is January 4, 2020.The candidates need to click on the link to view their respective question papers and the responses attempted. Candidates may login and click link for display of their question papers and responses attempted.The Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) has entrusted the responsibility of conducting CSIR-UGC NET in CBT mode to NTA. CSIR-UGC NET is a test being conducted to determine the eligibility 'for Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) and for Lectureship/Assistant Professor' in Indian universities and colleges.1) Log go to NTA official website - https://csirnet.nta.nic.in2) Click on the link 'Challenge/s regarding Answer Key', given on the homepage3) In the next screen, click on the 'Challenge/s regarding Answer Key'.4) Login with your Application Number and Date of Birth and enter Security Pin as displayed and Submit.5) Click 'Challenge/s regarding Answer Key'.6) You will see Question IDs in sequential order.7) The ID next to the question under the column 'Correct Option' stands for the correct Answer Key to be used by NTA.8) If you wish to challenge this option, you may use any one or more of the Option IDs given in the next four columns by clicking the check box.9) After clicking your desired option, scroll down, 'Save your Claim' and move to next screen.10) You will see a display of all the Option IDs you have challenged.11) You may want to upload supporting documents in which you can select 'Choose File' and upload (all documents to be put in a single PDF file).12) Click on 'Save your Claim Finally'.13) You will find a screen displaying your challenges.14) Kindly pay the fee by clicking on 'Click here to Pay Fee'.15) Select Mode of Payment and Pay your fee @ Rs. 1,000/- for each question challenged. Make payment through Debit/Credit Card/Net Banking.16) In case your challenge is found correct, your fee will be reimbursed in the same account.

Title: 5 fashion resolutions to make in 2020
Content: The last decade has been big on fashion. We saw an array of trends emerging in the last ten years. As we look forward to the new year, new trends, we also need to make some amendments. A new year brings in a chance to make a few changes in our lifestyle, which is also a great time to consider a few changes in your personal style. We've rounded up 5 such fashion resolutions you need to make in 2019:Trust us, when we say that. It's one of the biggest changes you can bring to your 2020 wardrobe. By organising your closet, we mean to your accessories, clothes and shoes. A lot of times, we end up forgetting a special gift we got or an essential accessory we bought during the sale. Once you organise your closet and can visually be able to see every purchase of yours, you can utilise your closet to the fullest.While you can mix and match a lot of clothes to try a new look, every day, it's also okay to repeat your clothes. The last year was all about going sustainable and 2020 can be a big opportunity to go big on the 'fashion-conscious' trend.This year, support local artists` and designers in India. This way you will end up buying something unique and handmade. It can help to revive old crafts and even support the local community.Do you know the fashion industry is one of the major polluting industries in the world? This year, make a pledge not to throw clothes, but to recycle and upcycle them. Make your decision wisely, know which clothes can be reused and turned into a new garment and which can be given away for recycling.The one thing that will be in 2020 is you. Yes, we mean it! Wear what pleases you and not just follow the trends. Whether you're curvy or petite, don't feel shy to flaunt your personal style.

Title: Manish Sisodia: BJP against affordable education, says Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia
Content:
Manish Sisodia

NEW DELHI: Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday alleged that BJP was against affordable and quality education and reforms in the sector. “BJP has forced a fourfold increase in the examination fees for the Class X and Class XII students of CBSE. While Delhi government is still committed to bear the full fees of government school students , this move by BJP has imposed a huge financial burden on private school students. These families are not going to forgive BJP,” said Sisodia.On June 22, CM Arvind Kejriwal had announced that Delhi government would pay examination fees for CBSE X and XII, which were Rs 450 for general and Rs 125 for SC/SC students. “This decision was benefitting more than 3.5 lakh students in government schools. BJP thought that this historic decision would affect their politics and hence they got the CBSE to increase the fees on August 2,” claimed Sisodia, adding that the fees were hiked to Rs 1,950 for general and Rs 1,650 for SC/ST students.“BJP should answer why the Delhi BJP forced CBSE to increase the fee four times. The steep hike has affected 6 lakh families of Delhi,” Sisodia said. He added that the AAP-led government paid the fees as promised.Delhi BJP spokesperson Harish Khurana, however, rubbished the allegations. “Sisodia and CM Arvind Kejriwal are experts in spreading rumours. Their education model is nothing but a propaganda. They should answer why 2 lakh students dropped out of Delhi government schools in 2019,” Khurana said.BJP leader Vijender Gupta said BJP has nothing to do with the exam fee hike as CBSE is an autonomous body. “The fees were raised after five years. CBSE generates its own funds through the fees of a number of public examinations,” a BJP leader said. CBSE had earlier said the hike was necessary as the board ran on no-profit, no-loss principle.In Video: BJP against affordable education: Manish Sisodia

Title: CAA Protest Latest News: ‘Nellai’ Kannan held after protest by BJP leaders
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

BJP leaders H Raja, Pon Radhakrishnan, C P Radhakrishnan and L Ganesan were arrested on Wednesday for protesti... Read More

MADURAI: Orator and writer ‘Nellai’ Kannan , who was booked for his ‘provocative speech’ against Prime Minister Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah, chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and deputy chief minister O Panneerselvam at an SDPI meeting in Tirunelveli city on Sunday evening, was arrested around 8.30 pm on Wednesday.

A senior police officer told TOI that Kannan was arrested by the Tirunelveli city police in a guest house in Perambalur district. The officer said he will be taken to the Trichy GH to confirm if he is fit to travel to Tirunelveli, where he will be produced before the judicial magistrate. If doctors say he cannot travel so long, he will be produced before a judicial magistrate in Trichy. “In either case, we will act on the directions of the magistrate. We will hospitalise him or remand him in jail under judicial custody as they say,” he said.

As he was arrested, BJP workers raised slogans against Kannan while SDPI cadres condemned the arrest. When he was taken out of the guest house, some protesters attempted to throw slippers at him.

On Monday night, the Melapalayam police booked him under Sections 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), 505(i)(b) (intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public, or to any section of the public whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the state or against public tranquillity), and 505 (ii) (statements creating or promoting enmity, hatred or ill-will between classes) of the IPC.

On Tuesday afternoon, Kannan was taken to a private hospital in Tirunelveli as he complained of chest pain. He had to be discharged in an hour as there was a strong protest by BJP cadres on the hospital premises. His family claimed that he will be taken to a hospital in Madurai but maintained confidentiality over the place fearing protest by BJP cadres.

Police said Kannan’s family took him to Madurai on Tuesday and then to Perambalur, where he was arrested due to pressure following the protest by senior BJP functionaries on the Marina on Wednesday. BJP national secretary H Raja, L Ganesan, C P Radhakrishnan and Pon Radhakrishnan along with 100 party workers were arrested for the sit-in protest in front of Gandhi statue on the Marina beach front. They had set a 24-hour deadline for the TN police to arrest him.

Title: Face-down posture in ICUs making big difference, say doctors
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: ICU stereotypes where patients are seen lying supine may have to change. A 50-year-old woman diagnosed with H1N1 and pneumonia, battling for life and put on ventilator in ICU for three weeks showed improvement after her posture was changed and she was made to lie in a prone (face-down) position.

Prone ventilation made a remarkable difference to the woman from Kuppam in Andhra Pradesh , said her doctors at Manipal Hospital, Whitefield. She has now recovered completely and has returned home.

The change of posture has been proven to be a lifesaving therapeutic measure for many such patients suffering from acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), pneumonia and other lung- related infections. The 32% mortality level in ARDS worldwide can be halved with this technique, said a French study from 2013-14. The practice is now being widely followed in most ICUs.

"It is used as a strategy to improve oxygenation when traditional modes of ventilation fail. In case of ARDS and H1N1 leading to pneumonia, the infection is largely in the posterior side of the lungs. If the anterior side gets oxygenated well, the recovery is faster," says Dr Rajesh Mohan Shetty, chief of clinical services, lead consultant, department of critical care medicine, Manipal Hospitals, Whitefield.

The method is gaining popularity now - especially on patients with H1N1 - seen largely during the winter season. At government-run Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Chest Diseases (RGICD), doctors said prone ventilation is a life saver for many patients. "Every day, it's used for at least one or two ARDS patients," says Dr C Nagaraj, director, RGICD. .

However, Dr Sandeepa HS, consultant pulmonologist, St Martha's hospital said prone ventilation cannot be used on all patients. "It is not used on pregnant women, patients suffering from myocardial infarction (heart attack) and those with long -standing lung infections. But it is very effective on patients with H1N1 who develop ARDS," Dr Sandeepa said.

Prone ventilation is administered in 3-4cycles, and in some cases, the cycles last up to 16 hours each depending on the severity of the infection. Though the treatment cost does not vary for prone position, it requires a minimum of two doctors and three nurses to change the position.

Title: Sensex rises over 100 points; Nifty reclaims 12,200
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: Equity benchmark BSE sensex rose over 100 points in opening session on Thursday led by gains in metal, energy and banking stocks amid positive cues fro Chinese markets.

The 30-share BSE index was trading 125.84 points or 0.30 per cent higher at 41,431.86. Similarly, the broader NSE Nifty rose 46.55 points or 0.38 per cent to 12,229.05.

Tata Steel was the top gainer in the sensex pack, rising up to 1.62 per cent, followed by UltraTech Cement, IndusInd Bank, Bharti Airtel, Bajaj Auto and Reliance Industries.

On the other hand, Titan was the top loser, shedding up to 0.94 per cent. NTPC, PowerGrid, Asian Paints and Mahindra and Mahindra were also trading in the red.

In the previous session, the 30-share gauge gained 52.28 points or 0.13 per cent to close at 41,306.02, while the Nifty settled 14.05 points, or 0.12 per cent, higher at 12,182.50

Meanwhile, on a net basis, foreign institutional investors sold equities worth Rs 58.87 crore, while domestic institutional investors purchased shares worth Rs 208.47 crore on Wednesday, data available with stock exchanges showed.

According to traders, domestic investors took positive cues from Asian markets after China's central bank announced fresh stimulus for the country's stuttering economy.

Bourses in Shanghai, Hong Kong were trading significantly higher, while those in Seoul were in the red. Stock exchanges in Tokyo remained closed for New Year holidays.

Brent futures, the global oil benchmark, slipped 0.32 per cent to $66.20 per barrel.

Meanwhile, the rupee depreciated 9 paise to 71.31 against the US dollar in morning session.

Title: Take New Year revelry out of MG Road, Brigade Road: V Somanna
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

BENGALURU: Housing minister V Somanna on Wednesday suggested police should consider declogging MG Road and Brigade Road by taking New Year Eve celebrations to other parts of the city. This, he said, will help avoid untoward incidents.

"Since the time i moved to Bengaluru 50 years ago, I have seen New Year celebrations are limited only to MG Road and Brigade Road. This may be the reason why some ugly incidents, like women getting mobbed or molested, are reported," the Govindarajanagar MLA said.

"I have also noticed the same kind of revellers congregate at Brigade Road and the miscreants having a pattern. We can have an arrangement to organise New Year bash in different locations. This way, even people from other parts of Bengaluru can take part in celebrations and return home safely, while personnel will be in a better position to manage any situation," the senior BJP leader added.

Two held for misbehaving with women

Ashoknagar police on Wednesday evening arrested two men and detained two others for misbehaving with women on Brigade Road on Tuesday midnight. The arrested are Shivkumar, 30, of Chikkamagaluru and Atul, 20, of Krishnagiri in Tamil Nadu .

Title: Pollution in Delhi: Delhi pollution levels remain 'severe', citizens advised to avoid outdoor activities
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

According to SAFAR, the overall AQI of the national capital was 426 with PM10 docking at 407 and PM 2.5 at 276... Read More

NEW DELHI: People in Delhi are still gasping for a breath of fresh air as the air quality of the national capital and its adjoining areas remained in the 'severe' category on Thursday.

Track the pollution level in your city

According to System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR), the overall Air Quality Index (AQI) of the national capital was 426 with PM10 docking at 407 and PM 2.5 at 276 at 9 in the morning today.

In Noida also, the air quality was not satisfactory in the morning as the AQI at PM 10 was 359 and PM 2.5 at 424.

According to SAFAR, "Under the influence of approaching western disturbance, increased surface winds and improved ventilation, AQI is forecasted to improve to the higher-end of the very poor category by the January 2."

Further significant improvement in AQI towards the middle-end of very poor to poor category is expecting by January 3. The organisation further predicted that tomorrow's (Friday) top three air pollution hot spots of the capital are likely to be Vinobapuri, Okhla and Bawana.

In an advisory, SAFAR has advised citizens to avoid physical outdoor activities including morning walks. "Stop any physical activity if you feel unusual coughing, chest discomfort, breathing difficulty or fatigue," it said.

It has also advised people to keep windows of their houses closed and asthmatics to keep medicines handy.

Title: Future is trying on your clothes virtually: Experts
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

BENGALURU: If the last decade transformed your shopping experience — ordering in from the comforts of your home using smartphones, or during a short break at work — the next decade will see technology change the way you shop online, besides revolutionising offline spaces.

As industry experts point out, the future of online apparel shopping is trying on clothes virtually, thanks to virtual and augmented reality-powered online and offline shopping spaces.

The digital trial room, as they term it, will require the customers to click a selfie, upload it on the online platform along with their height and weight. These inputs will create their online avatar to showcase how the outfit would fit them.

Abhishek Shetty, head (marketing), PR and loyalty at Celio says: “Online spaces report at least 30% to 40% of returns because of several factors — customers may not receive the right size or may not like how the product looks on them. Virtual trial rooms will help customers and sellers to a great extent.”

Not just this, as Amit Surendra Sawant, associate vice-president (marketing), Future Lifestyle Fashions points out, another technology — Magic Mirrors — will revolutionise brick-andmortar stores with experiential pop-ups and more.

Picture this: You step into a trial room with a bunch of clothes and want to try something similar in a different colour or style. Voila! mirrors turn into screens with a touch and slide option. A list of options pop-up and with just a click, your mirror reflection is now dressed in it!

“We intend to become a fashion experience centre with stores that will change like galleries, entertain like a show and build loyalty like clubs,” Sawant says, adding that technology will give consumers a virtual makeover in the coming years. The quick 360-degree photographs will help customers check-out how they look in a particular outfit from all the angles. Such technology will help salespersons evolve into fashion consultants, he added.

Tapan Acharya, chief revenue officer, Arvind Internet added these fashion consultants will be aided with a treasure of consumer data from online searches and shopping preferences.

Experts say the virtual shopping experience is the future of the presently evolving ‘Omnichannel’ Fashion retail, which is unifying a consumer’s online and offline demand. “If consumers can’t find their choice at the store, but it happens to be on our online platform, it will be delivered home,” Acharya said, adding that Arvind has ‘omnified’ 5,000 such stores across 500 brands in the last two years.

Although some experts bat for virtual reality (VR) technology and artificial intelligence revolutionising the physical shopping spaces in the way they have in China, Shetty says: “It’ll only work as a ‘wow’ factor. Serious consumers might want to try it themselves as they are already in the store rather than watching it on their photoshopped avatar.”

He says such trial rooms will entail massive costs and efforts, which the industry cannot afford now.

Title: Divya Deshmukh: Chess: Divya Deshmukh starts 2020 as India's No. 1 in U-16 girls
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Divya Deshmukh

NAGPUR: Teenage chess queen Divya Deshmukh started 2020 as country’s top master. Graduating to the Under-16 age-group last month, the 14-year-old was ranked India's No. 1 in the U-16 girls’ category in the ranking list released by the World Chess Federation ( FIDE ) on Wednesday.

In April last year, for the first time Divya took the top position in the world by becoming No. 1 in the U-14 age category and maintained her numero uno position in the same age-group for the next seven months. She turned 14 in December last month.

With international rating points of 2,322 in her kitty, Divya became U-16 No. 1 in India and is ranked fifth in the world. She is also India No. 1 in the U-18 girls’ group and second among the U-20 players in the country.

From 2,432 Elo in April 2019 to 2322 in the ranking list of January, she has lost as many as 110 Elo points . Losing a handful of rating points, however, cost Divya dearly as she lost the India No. 3 position, behind recently crowned World Rapid Chess Champion Koneru Humpy and Harika Dronavalli. In the women’s open group of Indian players, Divya has dropped to the No. 11 position.

City’s Mrudul Dehankar too jumped two places and is now India No. 3 in the U-16 girls’ group behind Divya and Tamil Nadu’s Rakshitta Ravi.

City’s only Grandmaster Raunak Sadhwani – also placed in the U-16 category after turning 14 last month – is India No. 4 in the U-16 group. With an Elo of 2522 Raunak is behind India’s top junior performers Nihal Sarin, Praggnanandhaa R and Gukesh D in the ranking list.

Similarly, Vidarbha’s third International Master (IM) Sankalp Gupta earned a handful of rating points to take his tally to 2,400 Elo. He is now at the 17th position in the country.

Title: Trai New Rules: Trai offers more TV channels at lower price
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: Broadcast regulator Trai has come out with a new tariff regulation, which will enable TV subscribers to access more channels at a lesser price. Trai made amendments to the regulatory framework for cable and broadcasting services and capped at Rs 160 the amount consumers will have to pay monthly for all freeto-air channels.

The regulator said it has decided that in case of multi-TV homes where more than one TV connection is working in the name of one person, it will charge a maximum of 40% of declared Network Capacity Fee (NCF) for the second and additional TV connections.

After examining various provisions, Trai has also reduced the maximum NCF charge to Rs 130 (excluding taxes) for 200 channels. Trai also decided that only those channels that have an MRP of Rs 12 or less will be permitted to be part of the bouquet offered by broadcasters.

In addition, it has also decided that channels declared mandatory by the information and broadcasting ministry will not be counted in the number of channels in the NCF. The authority has also permitted Distribution Platform Operators (DPOs) to offer discounts on long-term subscriptions that are for six months or more.

The sum of the a la carte rates of the pay channels forming part of a bouquet shall in no case exceed one-and-a-half times the rate of the bouquet of which such pay channels are a part, Trai said. The a la carte rates of each pay channel (MRP), forming part of a bouquet, shall in no case exceed three times the average rate of a pay channel of the bouquet of which such pay channel is a part, it further said.

Title: High court upholds reservation for contractors
Content:
This story is from January 2, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: The state government's decision to provide reservation to contractors belonging to Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribes (ST) in construction contracts has been upheld by the high court. Dismissing a petition filed by HM Vishwanath, a class -1 contractor from Bengaluru, justice B Veerappa has noted that reservation has been provided based on the principles of distributive justice to protect the interests of weaker sections of the society, particularly those belonging to SC-ST category.

In a notification issued on July 17, 2017, the state government provided up to 17.15% reservation for contractors belonging to SC category and up to 6.95% reservation for contractors belonging to ST category, with respect to contracts not exceeding Rs 50 lakhs. For this purpose, the Karnataka Transparency in Public Procurement Rules ,2016 was amended to insert rule 27 (A). The rules also provide that only in instances wherein no contractor from these two categories submit a response even after two attempts, a contract relating to such works may be tendered among others.

Title: This 20x20 ft BMC Urdu School in Kurla classroom has no benches, drinking water for 400 students
Content:
Kajupada BMC Urdu School

Gulshan-e-Millat Urdu High School

drinking water and playgrounds

What’s worse, the Jarimari Municipal Urdu School in Kurla has no drinking water for 400 students.The world is celebrating stepping into the new year and a new decade but three 20 x 20 feet rooms in the BMC-run Jarimari Municipal Urdu School in Kurla have over 400 students learning a hard lesson sitting on the floor. Established in 1971 in a donated building, the school doesn’t even have drinking water, let alone benches. Frequent power outages in poorly ventilated rooms and a single toilet for students and the staff is not the image an international city would like the world to see.The school houses grades 1to 4, with three divisions each, in the first shift from 7.30 am to 12.30 pm, and three divisions of grade 5 from 12.45 pm to 5.30 pm. All this in just three rooms. L-Ward Administrative Officer (schools) Saile Surve said the acute space crunch forced the BMC to not put benches. “On the floor, we can accommodate 35 students. With benches, the capacity will go down to 20,” she said, adding that the school was established to impart education to the local community and, therefore, can’t decline anyone from the area. “However, benches will force us to restrict the enrolment of students,” Surve said.Although the Jarimari School is not the only Urdu school in the area, teachers say parents from neighbourhood nodes prefer to send their children here for the reasons of proximity. “There are two Urdu primary schools run by the BMC –and– but ours is more popular. Most parents are engaged in household work in this area and like the idea of their children being close by. They fear for their safety and want to be available at all times,” a senior teacher said.The Right to Education (RTE) Act necessitates school infrastructure provisions such as all-weather buildings, a library, separate toilets for boys and girls,. However, the headmistress of the Jarimari School manages to buy only five litres of drinking water every day from the school funds. What she also can’t do anything about is the lack of proper toilet facilities and a library. There’s a common toilet used by both the students and the staff, but its ceiling leaks every monsoon.“It is disheartening to see kids sitting on the floor in the school. I have lodged multiple complaints with the BMC about the dilapidated condition of the building, but all I get is hollow assurances. The authorities have just turned a blind eye to all our problems,” said Imran Quraishi, a local activist.BMC education officer Mahesh Palkar washed his hands off the matter by claiming that the school building is neither owned by nor under the jurisdiction of the BMC, which runs India’s largest primary education network. “It’s a rented building, so we cannot renovate the space. Besides, there is no space in the neighbourhood to construct a new school. We are doing our best with limited resources,” Palkar said.An hour attending a grade 5 class reveals a mutual admiration club of teachers and parents. While the staff can’t praise the students enough, parents say the teachers step out of their comfort zones to impart education to their wards. “The results of our students here are better than the other schools,” said a senior teacher, who was transferred here recently. Until the authorities do something about the basic facilities, they want to pin their hopes on just education.
